title: What is up with plastic straws and saving turtles? - Reddit
body: Answer: Because a lot of the plastic straws (and other disposable garbage) end up in the ocean and is not always properly recycled/disposed. Hence, it creates pollution in the oceans and fucking up the environment. However, note that most of the sea pollution comes fishing practices (nets, plastic of all sorts, equipment, etc).
readable_content:

Hence, it creates pollution in the oceans and messing up the environment. However, note that most of the sea pollution comes from fishing practices (nets, plastic of all sorts, equipment, etc).

summary: The conversation highlights the environmental impact of plastic straws and the need to reduce their usage to prevent pollution in the oceans. The mention of the significant contribution of fishing practices to sea pollution also underscores the broader issue at hand. It's evident that there is concern about the negative effects of plastic waste on the environment. Sentiment: 0.8
